DataElement.preferredName: Part-Solid Nodule Longest Diameter Millimeter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The measurement, in millimeters, of the longest possible length of a straight line passing through a part-solid nodule.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Nodule with both ground-glass and solid components. The solid component corresponds to NO underlying normal anatomy, obscures the underlying lung structures and should measure at least 2 mm. The solid component should be measured in longest dimension.:The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Nodule with both ground-glass and solid components. The solid component corresponds to NO underlying normal anatomy, obscures the underlying lung structures and should measure at least 2 mm. The solid component should be measured in longest dimension.

Concepts.definition: Nodule with both ground-glass and solid components. The solid component corresponds to NO underlying normal anatomy, obscures the underlying lung structures and should measure at least 2 mm. The solid component should be measured in longest dimension.

Property.preferredDefinition: The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
